replies.commentBody: "What semi-rationale human expects me to believe this?".....Actually anyone would believe it if they could remember the facts. Every poll had Clinton winning the election. At the same Trump was loudly complaining that the election was rigged. Why, if the administration believed the polls, would any semi-rationale person believe they would go out of their way to possibly taint a Clinton victory by announcing just before the election that the Russians were helping Trump?

The belief was Hillary Clinton would win. It would have appeared partisan to bring this up at that time in the campaign and while an investigation was ongoing. Unlike the FBI, the WH took the high road.

No, Obama selectively leaked it for maximum impact, drip-drip-drip style.

This is a smear campaign initiated by Obama. He certainly knows his audience, which is willing to believe whatever he says without any real proof, but he seriously underestimates Trump, who's not about to let himself get smeared by a dirty politician. It will take more than innuendos to bring him down.

It's very simple really. If there's proof, let's see it.

comments.commentBody:
Just so that I'm clear on this: the Obama administration had definitive information linking the Trump campaign to Russians... but chose to kept it to themselves?
What semi-rationale human expects me to believe this?

IF Donald Trump is going to remain our president, if he survives the scandal that is enveloping his administration, he has to release his tax returns. That needs to be a condition for him to clear himself from the Russian probe. For Trump to remain our president, he has to prove that he is not financially compromised by debt to the Russian government. If he isn't willing to do that, don't let the door hit you on the way out. He should never have been allowed to get away with not releasing them in the first place.

This story, in combination with the WashPost's reporting on Sessions' contact with the Russian Ambassador, may not be a smoking gun (JFK once said where there's smoke, there's usually a smoke machine), but they should definitely open the door for appointment of a Special Prosecutor.  As Desi said to Lucy, "You got some 'splaining to do!".

replies.commentBody: If you say something enough times it may become the truth...Flint was under a state Republican administration....please get you facts straight...it was the states responsibility and not the EPA

When Trump gets to the point where he is danger of bringing down the Party with him, that's when the Republican's will act. Remember, the Republican's believe in everybody for themselves. They too will be scrambling to get off the ship if it looks like it's going to sink.
Exactly my sentiments. No one would care except elitist readers of New York Times, who with time will also succumb and accept their powerlessness in the face of naked betrayal of the country.

comments.commentBody:
In the end it will not matter whether the Trump campaign or Trump himself colluded with Russia to interfere with our election. Trump cares only about winning -- he won -- end of story. The GOP cares only about lowering taxes and being free to pollute our air and water -- they will achieve these goals -- end of story. Who cares that our country has been sold out? Who cares that the Administration is filled with Quislings? Only disgruntled liberal elitists like me and most readers of the Times.

I expected no better from Trump -- who appears to be too stupid to recognize treason when he sees it, or does it. I did expect somewhat better from the Republican Party, which has roots back to Lincoln and which trumpets its patriotism. Patriotism = What's good for Republicans. Hooray for the Red, White and Blue -- and also the White, Blue, and Red!
Trump and his crew of (alleged) dishonest and un-American comrades are finished...hopefully, many will be incarcerated for some years...

As disturbing as the Russian interference and sabotage of the U.S. election is,  the fact that the F.B.I's perception of impartiality and interest in getting to the truth has been compromised.  The F,B,I. and Comey as the agency head also interfered in the election. The investigation may be completely unbiased and honest, but they broke a cardinal rule. Developing trust in their actions could take a while.

Real Americans want to see Trump's taxes and know about his financial ties to Russian oligarchs and Putin. Putin obviously controls the oligarchs and assassinates or jails his political opponents.  Every Russian implicated in this scandal is turning up dead by Putin's hand. A real investigation would turn over the financials stones that caused Trump to be compromised and manipulated by Russia.  Without the Russians, Trump could never have been elected.  This is the real tragedy. Republicans could have chosen to run a real candidate, not a owned foreign puppet. If they fail to investigate, it confirms that many on the RNC are compromised too.
I got chills reading this. Even scarier are the holier than thou zealots like Nunes, McConnell, and Ryan giving cover to Trump and his gang. Is this not treason? Shame on them all.

Well here is the "smoking gun", that the Russians interfered in the election, and had contacts with Trump officials before the election. . Do I expect the Trump Administration, or Republicans in the House and Senate to investigate this?
Nope.

replies.commentBody: Honest people would welcome an investigation.

comments.commentBody:
I see some commenters wondering "Where's the beef? Isn't this just anonymous fluff? Is anything there?" The reason we don't have the content of these various connections and conversations is that they are classified and can only be viewed by an investigating committee with authority to view them. All the leaks in these stories are of unclassified information - Mr. X spoke with Mr. Y. The only way to get more detailed information is to bring some of the key players in to testify under oath as to the content of their communications.

Oh, and the Washington Post reports that the Jeff Sessions failed to disclose two contacts with the Russian ambassador during the campaign. He is the one who brought Carter Page into the Trump campaign. Sessions is clearly too compromised himself to conduct an investigation.

The only way forward here is an independent commission and/or special prosecutor who can hold both classified and unclassified briefings. There is no way to wish all of this away without a serious investigation.

And yet Trump supporters want us to move on just like they did with Benghazi and internet servers.  There is too much secrecy in the Trump administration, too many things that simply don't make sense.  It is hard to give him the benefit of the doubt with his continued refusal to release ANY of his tax returns.  I want to see if he has skin in the game. He certainly acts like he is insecure about the legitimacy of his victory. This Russia thing smells.  Bring it all out in the open.

The American people deserve to know the truth. Now. Considering the integrity of our democracy is at stake, Congress needs to appoint an independent prosecutor to fully investigate Russia's interference in our presidential election. Nothing less will do.

Deep gratitude to the NY Times for continuing to uncover the truth.

replies.commentBody:
"the majority of Americans according to polling, do not care about the conspiracy theories."

Guess again.

As an aside: polls are much like statistics - one can manipulate them to support whatever position one chooses.
No sabotage.  Merely assurance that vital information would be safeguarded from people known to be sleazy.

comments.commentBody: This is shocking. Elements of the previous administration and intelligence worked on a campaign to sabotage the incoming administration. So much for the peaceful transfer of power. Worse still, the media bought it, waging an unsubstantiated fear campaign about the "hacked election." The bright spot is that despite all this, the majority of Americans according to polling, do not care about the conspiracy theories. We will not have war with Russia.
Does Treason carry the death penalty?

replies.commentBody: Why, would we keep Pence if it is shown that Trump's win was fraudulent?  This is _very_ different from Watergate, right?  It's the whole Trump crew that likely will have to go, and some of them will be headed to jail.

comments.commentBody: This is very scary- If Trump is ever impeached by any of this- the GOP will have out Trumped' Trump by having their hardcore conservative V.P. immediately installed as the new Commander in Chief. At least with Trump I felt we had a chance to do some things - with Pence in charge we may as well beat him to the punch and start prayers in public schools now because we'll need all the help we can get.

" according to three former American officials who requested anonymity in discussing classified intelligence. "

Ah, yes. The unnamed officials. Haven't heard that one in a while. Busy working on another "explosive" and hilarious report on Trump they plan on leaking to Buzzfeed, I suppose?

The Investigation will reveal Trunp's financial support from Russia. This was never included in his Tax Documents. This is Tax Evasion,  a FELONY!  Trump will not only be impeached, but imprisoned as well.  Lock him up!

replies.commentBody: There are a few significant differences.  One being that Obama was a sitting president at the time he made his comments.  So, he was not potentially undermining another president.  Also, whatever Obama's reasons were, they obviously weren't related to his business holdings - big oil in particular.

Is there something wrong with that? President Obama was telling the truth.

Nixon's southern strategy corrupted the Republican Party.

comments.commentBody:
"American intelligence agencies routinely wiretap the phones of Russian diplomats, and transcripts of the calls showed that Mr. Flynn urged the Russians not to respond, saying relations would improve once Mr. Trump was in office, according to multiple current and former officials."

But of course The New York Times had no problem when President Obama whispered (but it was caught on tape) in 2012 to the Russian ambassador, "This is my last election," Obama said. "After my election I have more flexibility.”

replies.commentBody:
"The chances of bringing these criminals to justice seem very slim."

I'm sure that Nixon and his cronies thought they would get away with their crimes, too...

comments.commentBody:
Great job by the Obama administration for preserving intelligence on Trump associates. It all seems for naught as Trump himself said he can get away with murder. All his dirt and treasonous behavior will be swept under the rug by a majority Republican Congress, and his extremist advisors and attorney general.
The Trump administration is replete with those who believe they are above the law.
The chances of bringing these criminals to justice seem very slim.

replies.commentBody: The "loser" had a 2.9 million lead. We really need to get rid of the electoral college. I will never call this man my president.

comments.commentBody: I guess that even after living through the Republican field of clowns through the primaries, watching an election where the loser gets a 2 million popular vote lead - I guess I shouldn't be surprised that we are revving up for Dr. Strangelove remake.

replies.commentBody: Comey got his reward- kept his job.
Baloney.  This reeks of dirty politics.

comments.commentBody:
Lets consider why Obama did not publicly reveal this information but instead had to preserve it in a cloaked manner. He must have felt danger had he revealed it, a real concern in my view knowing the murderous shadow government, and I do.

Unfortunately, many will be disappointed to know that even if this information becomes public, we cannot have full confidence in it's honesty. Clearly, the F.B.I. Director Comey threw the election to Trump, not just the Russians and any F.B.I. investigation cannot be relied on. This bodes very ill for the public knowledge and the Congressional investigations that rely on the findings of the F.B.I.

We will never know the truth unless other sources with knowledge of the true facts come forward absent political motives and can prove legitimacy.

The GOP, which controls most state governments and now Congress and the Executive branch, cannot be bothered by Russian interference.  It is the goose that has laid a golden egg.  Trump and other billionaires have seen how wealthy Putin has become looting the Russian state and want to do the same here. Nothing will come of any of this intelligence.

As long as the NY Times commits whatever resources are necessary to this investigation, there is a ray of hope for the America that we know.  We are watching the dominoes of the Supreme Court and the US Congress fall against the continuing Republican attack on our society, but there might still be hope.  I do not want to imagine where four more years of such a toxic mixture of incompetence and corruption will lead.

This is one of the most frightening articles I have ever read. Concurrent with the revelations is the news reporting that seems to be backing off on Trump, giving him the benefit of the doubt ; it seems that much of the media is slowly kowtowing to this reprehensible man and his administration.

President Obama's legacy will rise from the ashes that have been dumped on it by the Trump administration. History will be kind to him. Not so for Trump and his cohorts.

I support the federal agencies' ongoing investigations and look forward to more being revealed.  Our system of checks and balances may be slow but we have a sufficient number of patriots both within and without our government who understand the rule of law and are astute in the face of nationalism being falsely characterized as democracy.
